newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Cosmos rises on higher output prospect.
newsitem.headline: Cosmos rises on higher output prospect.

text.p: Philippine soft drinks manufacturer Cosmos Bottling Corp rose 6.17 percent by midsession as buyers bought up the stock on prospects of higher production, brokers said.
"People are buying Cosmos due to its cheap price-earnings ratio, especially after it bought another plant," Noel Reyes, research head of Dharmala Securities, said.
The stock jumped by 25 centavos to 4.30 pesos with turnover amounting to 6.253 million shares.
The company recently bought the production plant of RC Cola in Laguna, south of Manila.
At present, Cosmos has only one plant operating in Bulacan, north of Manila.
